div.p: CCCC MS 51 contains a series of chronicles including Jerome's Latin translation of Eusebius of Caesarea's Chronici canones, the Chronica of Sigebert of Gembloux (c. 1030-1112) and the Abbreuiationes Chronicorum of Ralph de Diceto (d. c. 1202). In the early fourteenth-century catalogue of the cathedral priory of Christ Church, Canterbury manuscripts drawn up under Henry of Eastry this book is called Cronica Eusebii Salomonis, a reference to Salomon, a monk and sub-Prior of Christ Church in 1207. Salomon has also been identified as the possible compiler of a late twelfth-century collection of mnemonic verses and notes on the compotus now found in London, BL MS Egerton 3314.
